intro: Octarrhena vitellina, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Octarrhena vitellina is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
